div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:

description.value: FHIR implementation guide CH Core

valueMarkdown.value: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

description.value: PlaceOfBirth for ech-11
Place of Origin for eCH-0011
eCH-0010: Extension to define line types for addresses
Practitioner with GLN and name

The AHVN13 / NAVS13 - (abbreviation for new thirteen-digit Social Security number) - is an administrative identifier for natural persons in Switzerland. It is issued, announced and administered by the [Central Compensation Office](https://www.zas.admin.ch/zas/de/home/partenaires-et-institutions-/navs13.html). It is available to all organisations and communities for which there is a legal basis. The AHVN13 / NAVS13 shall not contain point characters for separation.
Identifier holding a 13 digit social security number. The number shall have exactly 13 digits and shall not contain point characters for separation.
Practitioner EPR with name with prefixes (salutation, academic title, legal status) and suffix (‘Facharzt für Allgemeine Medizin’)

Extension to reference the person (and her/his organization) who is responsible for the content (e.g. an author of an eMedication document or a recorder of an immunization). This extension is used to differentiate on entry level between the author of the content (represented with this extension) and the author of the medical decision or the performer of an event (represented e.g. with Resource.performer/informationSource).

The Business and Enterprise Register (BER) contains all enterprises and business in private and public law which are domiciled and exercise an economic activity in Switzerland. French: (REE) Registre des entreprises et des établissements. German: (BUR) Betriebs- und Unternehmensregister, Italian: (RIS) Registro delle imprese e degli stabilimenti.

Identifier holding a number for BER (Business and Enterprise Register), BUR (Betriebs- und Unternehmensregister), REE (Registre des entreprises et des établissements), RIS (Registro delle imprese e degli stabilimenti)

address incorporating eCH-0010 postal address extensions
Base definition for a composition with the CH Core profiles.
Base definition for a composition in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).
E-mail address as contact point of a person or organization according to eCH-0046
Internet address as contact point of a person or organization according to eCH-0046
Phone number as contact point of a person or organization according to eCH-0046
The Coverage referenced in the CH Core profiles.
Base definition for a document with the CH Core profiles.
Base definition for a document in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).
Base definition for a document reference with the CH Core profiles.
Base definition for a document reference in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).
The Encounter referenced in the CH Core profiles.

Base profile for a consent profile to document that a patient has an Electronic Patient Record (EPR) in Switzerland. The actual consent conditions are held within the EPR, this consent is the documentation in an organization that the patient has stated he has an EPR and this needs to be verified at the time of document publishing or reading. In addition a patient can request that specific information will not be published from the organization to the EPR. This can be documented with one or more references to encounters to exclude the consent for these.
Defines basic constraints and extensions on the Location resource for use with other CH Core resources
Defines basic constraints and extensions on the Organization resource for use with other CH Core resources
Core organization definition in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).

Core patient definition in the swiss context. Relevant are definitions by the eCH-0010 V7.0 data standard mailing address and eCH-0011 V8.1 data standard pesond data. The CH Core Patient is based upon the core FHIR Patient Resource and designed to meet the applicable patient demographic data elements in Switzerland. See also [BFS](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/register/personenregister/registerharmonisierung/nomenklaturen.html) for further information
Core patient definition in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR). It is used to include the patient in an EPR document (referenced in Composition/DocumentReference).
Postal address according to eCH-0010
Core practitioner definition in the swiss context.
Core practitioner definition in the context of the electronic patient record (EPR).
Core PractitionerRole definition in the swiss context.
Core PractitionerRole definition in the swiss context of the electronic patient record (EPR).

Identification for Forum Datenaustausch tariff types.
The detailed tariff list is avaible at this [url](https://www.forum-datenaustausch.ch/de/referenzdaten/)
Naming Convention for fore each tariff type is:
http://forum-datenaustausch.ch/tariff/[A-Z0-9]{3}

description.value: BFS defines variables for medical statistic (german, french, italian) see [BFS](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.7066232.html). Behandlung, Pflege, Rehabilitation nach dem Spitalaufenthalt. Es geht darum, den Behandlungserfolg resp. den Abhängigkeitsgrad bei Austritt anzugeben. Nur die am besten zutreffende Kategorie auswählen.
eCH-010 defines different Types for a postal address

eCH-011 defines different Types like Names, contactAdress etc. They are further described from the [BFS](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/register/personenregister/registerharmonisierung/nomenklaturen.assetdetail.349276.html) in 'Amtlicher Katalog der Merkmale' (Official catalogue of characteristics), Copyright BFS, Neuchâtel 2014, ISBN 978-3-303-00504-0

eCH-011 defines different maritalData separation zypes. See [maritalData - Zivilstandsangaben eCH-11](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.349276.html) and/or [BFS Amtlicher Katalog der Merkmale](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.349276.html).

eCH-011 defines different maritalStatus Types. See [maritalData - Zivilstandsangaben eCH-11](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.349276.html) and/or [BFS Amtlicher Katalog der Merkmale](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.349276.html).
eCH-011 defines different sex Types. See https://www.ech.ch/vechweb/page?p=dossier&documentNumber=eCH-0011&documentVersion=8.13.3.5 3.3.3.3 sex
eCH-0046 defines different types for e-mail categories. See https://www.ech.ch/de/ech/ech-0046/5.0 4.3.1 emailCategory
eCH-0046 defines different types for internet categories. See https://www.ech.ch/de/ech/ech-0046/5.0 4.5.1 internetCategory
eCH-0046 defines different types for phone categories. See https://www.ech.ch/de/ech/ech-0046/5.0 4.4.1 phoneNumberCategory

eCH-0007: Each municipality has a unique cantonal affiliation, which can be defined by the cantonal abbreviation commonly used in Switzerland.

name.value: eCH-0007 Canton Abbreviation incl. FL (Fürstentum Liechtenstein)

description.value: eCH-0007: Analogous to cantonAbbreviation, but contains the entry 'FL' for the Principality of Liechtenstein in addition to the actual cantons.

name.value: eCH-0007 Canton Abbreviation incl. FL (Fürstentum Liechtenstein)

description.value: eCH-0007 defines cantonAbbreviation/cantonFLAbbreviation (Kantonskürzel inkl. Fürstentum Liechtenstein), see [here](https://www.ech.ch/de/ech/ech-0007/6.0).

Extension to define the internet category according to eCH-0046
Extension to define the phone category according to eCH-0046
Patient with insurance card number as identifier, contact details, marital status (eCH & FHIR) and reference to the general practitioner (GP)

Ambulant Encounter of Mrs. Broennimann, representing the visit number (Fallnummer) and the BFS variables
Encounter Extension for suspected readmission
Extension to make a reference beween resources as entries in i.e. document bundles.
Extension for the confidentiality code according to the Swiss EPR regulation
Extension to define the information about the person and organisation that entered data and the time of the data input
Extension for a recipient of this document (corresponds to the addressee of a letter - person or organization)
Additional timestamp for the author or other elements.

EPR-SPID: The Central Compensation Office (ZAS; CCO) assigns and manages the new patient identification number according to the EPRA (EPR-SPID), which is only linked internally in the CCO with the AHV number. It maintains the UPI identification database (Unique Personal Identifier Database), which the EPR communities may access. The law regulates how the the EPR-SPID can be used. SR 816.111 states (Art. 10 para. 3 EPDV) that communities must ensure that the EPR-SPID number cannot be not stored in document repositories or document registries.
EPR-SPID Identifier (https://www.fedlex.admin.ch/eli/cc/2017/205/de)
eCH-0011: Extension to define first name type
Patient with place of birth, place of origin (Heimatort), religion, local PID and language of correspondence

Each healthcare partner (natural or legal person) is referenced with a unique code of type GLN (former name: EAN code) of the [GS1](https://www.gs1.ch/de/home) system. See [refdata](https://www.refdata.ch/content/partner_d.aspx)
Identifier holding a 13 digit GLN
Organization EPR with GLN, different contact details (e.g. phone, email) and address
PractitionerRole EPR with profession (role) and specialisation
Practitioner with GLN and ZSR, name with prefixes, gender and birth date
Name with extensions for ech-11

name.value: If an encounter is caused by an accident

description.value: Extension to define an encounter that is caused by an accident and at which time the accident happened
An Immunization example with extension for cross dokument referencing.
Identifier in 20-digit format. The number shall have exactly 20 digits and start with 756.
Patient with EPR-SPID ending on 0
eCH-0011: Extension to define the separation type. For married but separated persons and for persons in a registered partnership but living separately.
Patient with AHVN13/NAVS13 as identifier
Patient EPR with eCH-0011 family & and given name, eCH-0046 contact points and reference to the organization that is the custodian of the patient record
eCH-0011: Extension to define name type
Example for Composition Immunization Administration
Patient eCH-011 with names, marital status and separation type, delivery address if it is not the address of the patient (detailed explanation in narrative)
Organization with GLN (ending on 0), UIDB, BER

name.value: Place of Birth according to eCH-0011

description.value: The registered place of birth of the patient.

name.value: Place of Origin according to eCH-0011

description.value: The place of origin of the patient.
Organization EPR with specified healthcare facility type (Diagnostic institution)
Practitioner (physician assistants) with local identifier (neither GLN nor ZSR)
PractitionerRole with referenced practitioner and organization
Organization with specified healthcare facility type (Hospital)
Document EPR containing original representation as PDF-A (fullUrls of entries with ‘urn:uuid:’)

Unique IDentification Business (UIDB) number (in French, numéro d'IDentification suisse des Enterprises (IDE)) (in German, Schweizer Unternehmens-IDentifikationsnummer (UID)) (in Italian, numero d'IDentificazione svizzero delle Imprese (IDI)) Organizations Covered By System: All Companies/organizations registered in the public Swiss Registers such as the Swiss Register of Commerce, the Value Added Tax (VAT) register, the Social security agencies Registers, Cantons registers, etc., and publish in the UID Register.

Identifier holding a number for UIDB (Unique Identification Business), UID (Verwendung der Unternehmens-Identifikationsnummer), IDE (Utilisation du numéro d'identification des entreprises), IDI (Utilizzo del numero d'identificazione delle imprese)
Test Patient from UPI for Swiss EPR Projectathon

This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate how an individual participates in an encounter. In Switzerland the primary care physician is added to the extensible base ValueSet.

MaritalStatus combined by fhir and eCH-11. See [maritalData - Zivilstandsangaben eCH-11](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.349276.html) and/or [BFS Amtlicher Katalog der Merkmale](https://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/de/home/statistiken/kataloge-datenbanken/publikationen.assetdetail.349276.html).
eCH-010 defines different address lines (addressLine1,2 and street)
eCH-011 defines different nameData Types, this ValueSet is the subset for the firstnames
eCH-011 defines maritalData separation types
eCH-011 defines maritalStaus Types
eCH-011 defines different nameData Types, this ValueSet is the subset for the family name
eCH-011 defines these sex types
eCH-0046 defines these types of e-mail categories
eCH-0046 defines these types of internet categories
eCH-0046 defines these types of phone categories

The ZSR number is issued to self-employed, natural or legal persons (organisations) who can and want to work at the expense of health insurance. See [Sasis](https://www.sasis.ch/de/779). German: ZSR (Zahlstellenregister), French: RCC (Registre des codes-créanciers), Italian: RCC (Registro dei codici creditori).
Identifier holding a number for ZSR (Zahlstellenregister), RCC (Registre des codes-créanciers), RCC (Registro dei codici creditori)
Composition EPR with the information about the transfer in different sections
Document EPR (fullUrls of entries with ‘http’)
